title: Primark pulls tea towel from sale because it has so many errors
text:
The tea towel map of the capital has been pulled from sale because of so many errors on it (Picture: Triangle News)

If you bought this tea towel in Primark, it’s best not to use it for reference when navigating London.

The map of the capital has been pulled from sale because of so many errors on it.

It showed the city’s major landmarks in the wrong places, such as putting the London Eye north of the River Thames.

Big Ben was not connected to the Houses of Parliament, and was also on the wrong side of the river.

Westminster Abbey was also incorrectly located on the south bank.

And The Gherkin and St Paul’s Cathedral both featured on the wrong side of Tower Bridge.

You can take it back for a refund (Picture: Triangle News)

There was also a spelling mistake with ‘Westminster’ spelled ‘Westminister’

Vic Norman – who does historical walking tours in London – said: ‘It’s not only geographically challenged, the spelling and punctuation need a makeover.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘And don’t get me started on Swans taller than taxis.’

The tea towels which came in a multi-pack were on sale for £2.50.

But Primark decided to withdraw them after the embarrassing mistakes were spotted.

That should read ‘Westminster’ (Picture: Triangle News)

Big Ben is in the wrong place (Picture: Triangle News)

If you bought one and are horrified by the errors, you can take it back to the shop and get something else instead.

A Primark spokesman said: ‘Where we identify a typing error on one of our products, we will remove the product concerned from sale as quickly as possible.

‘Customers who purchased the product can return it to one of our stores for a full refund and we apologise for any inconvenience caused.’
